question: 実力
sourceMnemonic: The <kanji>truth</kanji> behind someone's <kanji>strength</kanji> is their <vocabulary>true strength</vocabulary>. It is also their <vocabulary>true ability</vocabulary>.
sourceReadingMnemonic:
This is a jukugo word, which usually means on'yomi readings from the kanji. Since <ja>力</ja> has two on'yomi readings, here's a mnemonic to help you remember which one to use:

Your <vocabulary>true strength</vocabulary> is sealed behind two locks. <reading>Gee, two</reading> <reading>lock</reading>s (<ja>じつりょく</ja>)?! People must have been scared of your <vocabulary>true power</vocabulary> to seal it behind two locks!
